story: A farmer has 125 apples. He buys 200 more. How many does he have now?
Lily has 150 marbles. She finds 50 more. How many marbles does she have in total?
Jack read 45 pages of a book on Monday and 30 pages on Tuesday. How many pages did he read altogether?
A school has 20 classrooms. Each classroom has 15 desks. How many desks are there in total?
A baker made 100 cookies. He makes 50 more. How many cookies does he have now?
A family has 3 cats. Each cat has 4 toys. How many toys are there in total?
A gardener plants 15 flowers in the morning and 25 in the afternoon. How many flowers did he plant in total?
A toy store sold 30 dolls and then received 50 new dolls. How many dolls does the store have now?
A train has 100 passengers at the start. 25 more passengers board at the next station. How many passengers are on the train now?
A library has 300 books. If 50 more books are donated, how many books are there now?
A baker had 300 cookies. He sold 125. How many cookies are left?
Lily has 150 marbles. She gives 50 to her friend. How many marbles does she have left?
Tom had 200 dollars. He spent 75 dollars on a toy. How much money does he have left?
A farmer had 500 apples. He sold 200. How many apples does he have now?
A school had 250 students. 50 students transferred to another school. How many students remain?
A library had 1000 books. If 300 books were checked out, how many books are left?
A toy store had 150 toys. If 40 toys were sold, how many toys are left?
A pizza place had 80 pizzas. If 25 pizzas were eaten, how many are left?
A family had 60 cookies. They ate 20. How many cookies are left?
A doctor had 500 patients. 100 patients were discharged. How many patients are left?
A school has 20 classrooms. Each classroom has 15 desks. How many desks are there in total?
A gardener plants 5 rows of flowers. Each row has 12 flowers. How many flowers are there in total?
A box contains 24 chocolates. If you have 3 boxes, how many chocolates do you have?
A baker makes 12 loaves of bread each day. How many loaves does he make in a week?
A farmer has 10 cows. Each cow produces 5 gallons of milk per day. How many gallons of milk do they produce in a day?
A school has 15 students in each class. If there are 4 classes, how many students are there in total?
A box of pencils contains 10 pencils. If you buy 5 boxes, how many pencils do you have?
A car travels 60 miles in one hour. How far will it travel in 4 hours?
A farmer grows 15 rows of corn. Each row has 20 plants. How many corn plants are there in total?
A pizza is cut into 8 slices. If each slice costs $2, how much do all the slices cost?
A group of 48 children is divided into 6 equal teams. How many children are in each team?
A baker made 120 cookies. If he packs them into boxes of 10, how many boxes does he need?
A school has 300 students. If they are divided into 10 classes, how many students are in each class?
A farmer has 60 apples. If he puts them into bags of 12, how many bags does he need?
A box contains 36 chocolates. If 9 chocolates are eaten, how many are left for sharing equally among 3 friends?
A truck can carry 2400 pounds. If each bag weighs 300 pounds, how many bags can the truck carry?
A pizza is cut into 12 slices. If 4 slices are eaten, how many slices are left?
A classroom has 40 chairs. If the chairs are arranged in 5 rows, how many chairs are in each row?
A gardener has 100 seeds. If he plants them in groups of 10, how many groups does he make?
A library has 240 books. If 12 books are on each shelf, how many shelves are needed?
A train departs at 2:30 PM and arrives at 5:45 PM. How long was the journey?
A movie starts at 7:15 PM and ends at 9:00 PM. How long is the movie?
A meeting lasts for 2 hours and starts at 10:00 AM. What time does it end?
A train takes 1 hour and 30 minutes to reach its destination. If it leaves at 3:00 PM, what time will it arrive?
A basketball game lasts 2 hours. If it starts at 5:00 PM, what time does it finish?
